cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles W of San Andres Island
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across Nicaragua and Honduras, emerging into the north-western Caribbean Friday, then expected to arc northward over the Gulf of Mexico toward the U.S. central Gulf Coast before curving inland across the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic states.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast (eastern Louisiana to Alabama)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch and Hurricane Watch confined to north-western Caribbean and Yucatán Peninsula (not Mid-Atlantic).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Sandy Bay Sirpi, Nicaragua to Punta Castilla, Honduras.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central America (Nicaragua, Honduras), Yucatán Peninsula, U.S. central Gulf Coast, interior Southeast, and portions of the Mid-Atlantic states.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (<5%) of tropical-storm-force winds late Monday–Tuesday; breezy conditions possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the port with current track.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible early next week as remnants move through, potentially causing localized ponding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river or urban flooding could delay cargo movements and yard operations.
